title: Chengdu Scallion Pancakes
source: The Book of Sichuan Chili Crisp - Jing Gao
categories: The Book of Sichuan Chili Crisp - Jing Gao
ingredients: - 2 cups / 250g all-purpose flour, or as needed
- ⅔ cup / 160ml hot water, or as needed
- 5 or 6 scallions, green parts only, thinly sliced
- Sichuan Chili Crisp or Chili Crisp Vinaigrette for serving
directions: 1. Combine the flour and hot water in a bowl and knead for about 5 minutes until a smooth dough forms. Adjust flour or water as needed. Cover and rest for at least 30 minutes.2. On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough into a long rectangle about ½-inch thick.3. Spread lard over the dough using a spoon or brush, then sprinkle with salt, mala spice mix, and scallions.4. Roll the dough sheet into a log from the edge closest to you. Cut the log into four equal pieces.5. Flatten each piece into a pancake about ¾ inch thick (or thinner for crispier pancakes).6. Heat vegetable oil in a nonstick pan over medium heat. Fry each pancake for 7 to 8 minutes, flipping until golden and cooked through.7. Slice and serve hot with soy sauce and chili crisp or vinaigrette.
